descript.abstract: Contains regional building footprint data including average building heights created and complied by Watershed Sciences from regional Lidar data. In instances where Lidar point density was insufficient to establish a footprint, Watershed Sciences either 1) digitized footprint from 2008 Ortho photography or 2) used existing footprint data provided by the Jurisdiction.
descript.purpose: The data was collected to provide a means to estimate building floor area as well as serve as a repository for building related regional data.
descript.supplinf: First release of data is slated for November 15, 2010 as a part of the RLIS Lite package.

idinfo.useconst: For product terms and conditions, please see http://www.oregonmetro.gov/index.cfm/go/by.web/id=505

horizpa.horizpar: Registered to tax lots. Street center lines were digitized from aerial orthophotography at +/- 10 feet accuracy. Tax lots were fit to the street centerlines. Beaverton, Oregon City and Tigard planning areas were improved to +/- 5 feet accuracy. Multnomah County was created with coordinate geometry using better control.

procstep.procdesc: Received regional building footprints from Watershed Sciences.

Corrected Topology Errors. Approximately 350 topology errors (Does not overlap) existed in the Watershed Sciences delivered data. Metro staff corrected these errors. Some were duplicate buildings along delivery boundaries.

Added additional heights and confidence rating. Buildings where heights could not be generated by Watershed Science's process were processed using a 3-foot resolution feature height model (FHM; highest hits minus bare earth) and the following steps1. Watershed Science heights were assigned a confidence of High 2. Features were buffered using a negative 3-foot buffer. This was done to try to account for buildings with trees overhanging the edges and any misalignment of the footprint to the FHM. 3. Zonal Statistics were generated for all buffers 4. For all average heights over 5 feet, the following height confidences were used:a. Medium - Standard Deviation of 2 or less
b. Medium-Low - Standard Deviation greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4
c. Low - Standard Deviation greater than 4 and less than or equal to 10
d. N/A - Standard Deviation greater than 10 (no height assigned)
e. Oregon City - heights assigned from original Oregon City building heights

Assigned Unique building IDs. Unique Building IDs were assigned based on the Taxlot (state ID) in which the centroid falls. The general format is [StateID]-B# i.e. 41E24D-00100-B6 would be the sixth building with a centroid that falls on taxlot 41E24D 00100. Duplicate values will be present if the [Multipoly} field is TRUE.

Assigned Subarea. Subarea values of City of Portland and City of Portland - BPS were assigned to buildings that will be mainteained byt the City of Portland. At the time of update all buildings within City of Portland maintenance areas will be replaced with their data.
Added "Oregon City" and "West Linn" Maintenance areas. Added two new fields: "Square feet Source" [sqft_src], and "Square Feet Confidence" [sqft_conf]
Footprints updated based on 2010 aerial photos within the West Linn, Oregon City, and Tigard maintenance areas. Ongoing updates in City of Portland.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The level of confidence in the value in [Bldg_Sqft]
Unique ID assigned by Watershed Sciences upon initial delivery
State Taxlot ID that the centroid of the building falls within
the number of the building on the taxlot. Bldg_ID is made up of State_ID + "_B" + Bldg_Numb
Common Name of building. i.e. "Oregon Convention Center"
Primary building address (default is from Assessor's record)
Type of Building (i.e. Single-Family Residence) Domain values to be determined
Unique Building ID number. Duplicates are allowed as each part of a multipart buildings will have the same ID
the LEED rating of the building
Additional Reference for building footprint source (i.e. building permit number if footprint derived from building permit)
Confidence of Height Data (see domain for details)

edom.edomvd: Height data determined by classified Lidar points or actual data from building permits/as-builts
Height determined from 3 ft. Feature Height Model with a standard deviation of 2 or less
Height value was not available or had a standard deviation of greater than 10.
Height determined from 3 ft. Feature Height Model with a standard deviation of greater than 4 less than or equal to 10
Height determined from 3 ft. Feature Height Model with a standard deviation of greater than 2 less than or equal to 4

attr.attrdef: Elevation of the surface at the base of the building
Offset from Surface (i.e. sky bridge would be a positive offset, basement floor would be a negative offset)
Roof Elevation. Height plus Adjusted Surface
Yes/No flag if building is a single or multi-part building

edom.edomvd: BPS - Portland Bureau of Planning and Sustainability
See Modifier Column for Full Values List
See Modifier Column for Full Values List

attr.attrdef: The source of the value in [Bldg_Sqft]

distinfo.distliab: The information in this file was derived from digital databases on Metro's GIS. Care was taken in the creation of this file. Metro cannot accept any responsibility for errors, omissions, or positional accuracy. There are no warranties, expressed or implied.

digtinfo.formname: Shapefile or ESRI geodatabase format. Hourly fee will be charged for conversion

onlinopt.accinstr: Most RLIS layers are available on the RLIS Discovery site. Email drc@oregonmetro.gov or call 503 797-1742 for further instructions.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
